availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry E. Shawhan (Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Harrison County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Joseph Ewalt Shawhan. Married to Shawhan. Father of Joseph W Shawhan, Hubbard W. Shawhan, Sarah E. Shawhan, Sarah M. Shawhan, Margaret R. Shawhan, Cynthia A. Shawhan, Ann E. Shawhan, Henry Shawhan. Married Sarah "Sallie" Culp Shawhan in Pike County, Missouri on October 18, 1859. Farmer in Harrison County in 1850. Owned nineteen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1850. Farmer in Harrison County in 1860. Owned eighteen enslaved persons in Harrison County in 1860.

ab.bibl:

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, District 2, p. 508.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Harrison County, p. 414.

Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1914), KDLA, Roll #994027-99058, Harrison County Marriages, p. 131-132.
_Missouri Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1825-1865), Missouri State Archives, Missouri Marriage Records Pike County Marriages, p. 288.
